subtopics.par: Some companies pay a certain percentage of their profits, called dividends, to their investors.
list: 1-5% of the stock price per year, paid quarterly
S&P 500 gives about 2%, so investing in the market long term pays good dividend
Keeping a dividend stock for 20 years will likely result in more coming from the dividend than the stock itself
Only do this with stocks that will last a long long time
Make sure you reinvest the dividends, because it will compound
Most growth companies donâ€™t pay dividend
Look in the top 100 companies in the S&P 500, and the market itself
There are also ETFs for dividend stocks only, like VIG

subtopics.par: Always account for stock appreciation, resulting in total return. The chart below shows stock appreciation vs. total return.
list: Dividend amount - the dollar amount that is provided
Dividend yield - the percentage of the stock price that the dividend amount is
